miRNA targets that are significantly enriched at L1 larva stage. To generate a global view of the dynamics of miRNA-mediated regulation of gene expression during C. elegans development, authors analyzed the mRNAs in the AIN-2-GFP IP results from five developmental stages. The magnitude of the combined interaction of miRNAs with a given target mRNA was assessed by measuring the fold enrichment of that mRNA in AIN-2 IP samples, relative to the abundance of the mRNA in the corresponding total lysate. Because this enrichment in the IP sample versus total lysate directly reflects the miRISC-associated fraction of a given mRNA, high enrichment indicates the likelihood of strong miRNA-mediated regulation of the mRNA, whereas low or negative enrichment indicates the likelihood of weak or absent miRNA regulation of the mRNA. It is also possible that poor enrichment could reflect interactions that occur only in a rare subset of cells at any given stage of development. Transcripts that were significantly enriched (0<P<0.001) was used as the cutoff for significant enrichment, which indicates significant AIN-2 miRISC association of the transcript in the corresponding development stage. Negative P values indicate depletion of the transcript from AIN-2 IP compared with the corresponding total lysate.
Transcripts that showed significantly decreased expression after animals were treated with 100uM Psora and 250uM Allantoin from day 1 to day 3 adult hermaphradite.
Genome-wide analysis of developmental and sex-regulated gene expression profile.
DAF-16 binding DNA target identified by chromatin profiling by DNA adenine methyltransferase identification (DamID).
Genome-wide analysis of developmental and sex-regulated gene expression profile.
Transcripts that showed significantly decreased expression in daf-16(RNAi) animals comparing to in control animals.
Genes that showed increased expression after germline ablation comparing to un-ablated animals.
Significantly downregulated genes from cyc-1(RNAi) microarrays using SAM algorithm with an FDR < 0.1 from adult-only chips.
Genes with small RNAs downregulated in all four meg-3(ax3055) meg-4(ax3052) strains comparing to N2
A complete list of the genes that showed differential expression in a slr-2 mutant strain.
Transcripts expressed in GABAergic neuron, according to PAT-Seq analysis using Punc-47-GFP-3XFLAG mRNA tagging.
Genes significantly enriched (> 2x, FDR < 5%) in a particular cell-type versus a reference sample of all cells at the same stage.
Genes from N2 animals with significantly decreased expression after 72 hours of treatment on growth media with 250uM allantoin in 2% DMSO.

Transcripts that were significantly enriched (0<P<0.001) was used as the cutoff for significant enrichment, which indicates significant AIN-2 miRISC association of the transcript in the corresponding development stage. Description: In the germline itself, DAF-16::GFP is barely detectable, indicating that daf-16 is expressed at low levels in this tissue. DAF-16::GFP, however, is expressed at high levels in the somatic gonadal sheath cells, localizing to the nuclei of these cells under normal fed conditions.

evidence.Algorithm: Fold change >= 4.

Description: DAF-16B is expressed in AIY.

Paper.label: Christensen R, de la Torre-Ubieta L, Bonni A & Colon-Ramos DA, 2011

Description: GFP expression was observed in many tissues from early embryogenesis to the mature adult. Expression was particularly strong in many neurons in the nerve ring and tail. In well fed worms the GFP was mainly diffuse and throughout the cells but the GFP became more nuclear-localized upon starvation.

Paper.label: Craig HL, Wirtz J, Bamps S, Dolphin CT & Hope IA, 2013
Feng H, Craig HL & Hope IA, 2012

Description: Expressed in anterior neurons (not individually identified in this study) from L2 to L4, posterior neurons from L2 to L4, body wall muscle from L2 to adult.

Expressed in lateral hypodermal cells from L2 to L4, vulval muscle in some adult animals, anterior neurons (not individually identified in this study) from L2 to L4, posterior neurons in some L2/L3 and adult animals, body wall muscle from L2 to adult.

GFP expression was observed in many tissues from early embryo to mature adult. GFP fluorescence was particularly strong in many neurons in the nerve ring and tail, and in some neurons in the ventral nerve cord. One unidentified neuron in the tail showed particularly strong expression such that its axon, projecting towards the anterior, was also visibly fluorescing. GFP was mainly diffuse and spread throughout the cells in which it was expressed, but in some individuals the fluorescence  in some tissues, such as the seam cells, was much brighter in the nucleus.

Paper.label: Craig HL, Wirtz J, Bamps S, Dolphin CT & Hope IA, 2013
Feng H, Craig HL & Hope IA, 2012

Description: Expression is observed from early embryogenesis to adult. Early embryonic expression is in peripheral cells. From late embryogenesis to adult, expression is seen in the pharynx, rectal glands, a subset of ventral nerve cord cells, a single neuron with a cell body in the tail and processes along the ventral side to the nerve ring. There is also expression in the vulva and somatic gonad, possibly the distal tip cells, and possibly the germ line.

GFP expression was observed in many tissues from early embryo to mature adult. GFP fluorescence was particularly strong in many neurons in the nerve ring and tail, and in some neurons in the ventral nerve cord. One unidentified neuron in the tail showed particularly strong expression such that its axon, projecting towards the anterior, was also visibly fluorescing. GFP was mainly diffuse and spread throughout the cells in which it was expressed, but in some individuals the fluorescence  in some tissues, such as the seam cells, was much brighter in the nucleus.

Paper.label: Craig HL, Wirtz J, Bamps S, Dolphin CT & Hope IA, 2013
Feng H, Craig HL & Hope IA, 2012

Description: GFP expression was observed in many tissues from early embryogenesis to the mature adult. Expression was particularly strong in many neurons in the nerve ring and tail. In well fed worms the GFP was mainly diffuse and throughout the cells but the GFP became more nuclear-localized upon starvation.

Paper.label: Craig HL, Wirtz J, Bamps S, Dolphin CT & Hope IA, 2013

Description: Expression is observed from early embryogenesis to adult. Early embryonic expression is in peripheral cells. From late embryogenesis to adult, expression is seen in the pharynx, rectal glands, a subset of ventral nerve cord cells, a single neuron with a cell body in the tail and processes along the ventral side to the nerve ring. There is also expression in the vulva and somatic gonad, possibly the distal tip cells, and possibly the germ line.
daf-16 is enriched in the gonad.

The functional GFP::DAF-16B fusion protein fluorescence was first detected in early embryos, prior to morphogenesis. After hatching and in all later developmental stages, transgenic larvae showed GFP in the pharynx and in many neurons throughout the body. From the late L3 stage onward, GFP was also detected in somatic gonads.

Paper.label: Lee RYN, Hench J & Ruvkun G, 2001

Description: Expressed in anterior neurons (not individually identified in this study) from L2 to L4, posterior neurons from L2 to L4, body wall muscle from L2 to adult.

Expressed in lateral hypodermal cells from L2 to L4, vulval muscle in some adult animals, anterior neurons (not individually identified in this study) from L2 to L4, posterior neurons in some L2/L3 and adult animals, body wall muscle from L2 to adult.

evidence.Description: Transcripts that showed significantly increased expression in PLM neuron cells comparing to in whole animal, according to dissected single neuron RNASeq analysis.
evidence.Algorithm: Fold change >= 4.

Description: Transgenic daf-16a::GFP animals show strong GFP fluorescence in most cells including ectoderm, muscles, intestine and neurons. The broad expression pattern of daf-16a::GFP is also seen in late embryos, larvae and dauer larvae. No expression was seen in the pharynx.

The daf-16a promoter::gfp fusion construct (pPV199) was expressed in all life stages of C. elegans transformants. Bright fluorescence was seen in cells of the body wall, muscles, intestine and neurons but not in the pharynx or gonad.

Paper.label: Massey HC, Bhopale MK, Li X, Castelletto M & Lok JB, 2006

Description: daf-16d/f expression is dramatically increased at the level of transcription during the young adult stage in the intestine.
GFP::DAF-16 protein localized to neurons, hypodermis, intestine, and body wall muscles.

Paper.label: Schindler AJ, Baugh LR & Sherwood DR, 2014

evidence.Description: Genes enriched in intestine.

Citation.label: Pauli F, Liu Y, Kim YA, Chen PJ & Kim SK, 2006

evidence.Algorithm: To identify genes that are significantly enriched by mRNA tagging, we first normalized the total amount of Cy3 and Cy5 signal to each other in each hybridization. We measured the ratio of the signals from the co-immunoprecipitated mRNA (Cy5) to total RNA in the cell extract (Cy3), and calculated the percentile rank for each gene relative to all genes in each hybridization. The mean percentile rank was determined from eight repeats of the mRNA-tagging experiment. Student's t-test was used to determine which genes showed a mean enrichment significantly greater than the median enrichment for all genes (P<0.001).

evidence.Description: Genes enriched in intestinal AIN-2 miRISCs. Pges-1-ain-2-gfp IP was performed in mixed stage worms.

Citation.label: Kudlow BA, Zhang L & Han M, 2012

evidence.Algorithm: Enrichment values are expressed as mean percent rank. The p value was computed by comparing all enrichment values for a given transcript to all enrichment values of all transcripts by a one-tailed t test. Significantly enriched genes are those with p value < 0.01.

evidence.Description: Genes enriched in L4 larva intestinal AIN-2 miRISCs, potentially involved in non-development processes. Pges-1-ain-2-gfp IP was performed in synchronized L4 larva.

evidence.Description: Genes enriched in neuronal miRNA-induced silencing complexes (miRISC) as detected by immunoprecipitations and microarray analysis.

Citation.label: Than MT, Kudlow BA & Han M, 2013

evidence.Algorithm: Testable genes were defined as having reliable signals in two different biological replicates using the Agilent microarray chip. Multiple probes for the same gene were removed, keeping the probe with the lowest p-value as defined by a one-tailed t-test comparing all testable probes versus probes towards a designated gene. The testable data was then supplemented with the enrichment values (as percent ranks) of a fifth replicate, from another microarray platform GPL5883 (which had a single probe for each gene), and statistical significance was re-calculate. p < 0.001 was the final cutoff.

Description: GFP was first detected in comma-stage embryos. After hatching, transgenic animals showed high levels of GFP expression in almost all somatic cells. In contrast to the daf-16b fusion gene, little GFP was detected in somatic gonad or pharynx (except occasionally in one or two unidentified cells in the terminal bulb).

Paper.label: Lee RYN, Hench J & Ruvkun G, 2001

evidence.Description: Transcripts that showed significantly increased expression in AFD neuron cells comparing to in whole animal, according to dissected single neuron RNASeq analysis.
evidence.Algorithm: Fold change >= 4.

evidence.Description: Genes with expression enriched in PVD and OLL neurons. Data sets were normalized by RMA and transcripts showing relative PVD enrichment (>= 1.5X) vs. the reference sample were identified by SAM analysis (False Discovery Rate, FDR < 1%).
evidence.Algorithm: Data sets were normalized by RMA and transcripts showing relative PVD enrichment (>=1.5X) vs. the reference sample were identified by SAM analysis (False Discovery Rate, FDR < 1%)

Description: DAF-16B is expressed in AIY.

Paper.label: Christensen R, de la Torre-Ubieta L, Bonni A & Colon-Ramos DA, 2011

Description: GFP::DAF-16 protein localized to neurons, hypodermis, intestine, and body wall muscles.

Paper.label: Schindler AJ, Baugh LR & Sherwood DR, 2014

evidence.Description: Genes that show selective expression in a subset of cell types vs broadly expressed in many cell types. Correspond to 20% - 57% of enriched_genes for a given cell type.
evidence.Algorithm: A Mann-Whitney U test with an empirical background model and FDR correction for multiple testing was used to detect expressed transcripts (Benjamini and Hochberg 1995). Genes and TARs with an FDR <= 0.05 were reported as expressed above background. Authors detected differentially expressed transcripts using a method based on linear models. Genes and TARs were called differentially expressed if the FDR was <= 0.05 and the fold change (FC) >= 2.0. To more strictly correct for potential false-positives resulting from multiple sample comparisons, authors divided individual FDR estimates by the number of samplesor sample comparisons, respectively. This resulted in an adjusted FDR of 1.3 * 0.0001 for expression above background and of 7.4 * 0.0001 for differential expression. Authors called genes selectively enriched in a given tissue if they met the following requirements: (1) enriched expression in a given tissue (FDR <= 0.05 and FC >= 2.0), (2) fold change versus reference among the upper 40% of the positive FC range observed for this gene across all tissues, and (3) fold-change entropy among the lower 40% of the distribution observed for all genes.

evidence.Description: Genes significantly enriched (> 2x, FDR < 5%) in a particular cell-type versus a reference sample of all cells at the same stage.
evidence.Algorithm: A Mann-Whitney U test with an empirical background model and FDR correction for multiple testing was used to detect expressed transcripts (Benjamini and Hochberg 1995). Genes and TARs with an FDR <= 0.05 were reported as expressed above background. Authors detected differentially expressed transcripts using a method based on linear models. Genes and TARs were called differentially expressed if the FDR was <= 0.05 and the fold change (FC) >= 2.0. To more strictly correct for potential false-positives resulting from multiple sample comparisons, authors divided individual FDR estimates by the number of samplesor sample comparisons, respectively. This resulted in an adjusted FDR of 1.3 * 0.0001 for expression above background and of 7.4 * 0.0001 for differential expression. Authors called genes selectively enriched in a given tissue if they met the following requirements: (1) enriched expression in a given tissue (FDR <= 0.05 and FC >= 2.0), (2) fold change versus reference among the upper 40% of the positive FC range observed for this gene across all tissues, and (3) fold-change entropy among the lower 40% of the distribution observed for all genes.

Description: Expression is observed from early embryogenesis to adult. Early embryonic expression is in peripheral cells. From late embryogenesis to adult, expression is seen in the pharynx, rectal glands, a subset of ventral nerve cord cells, a single neuron with a cell body in the tail and processes along the ventral side to the nerve ring. There is also expression in the vulva and somatic gonad, possibly the distal tip cells, and possibly the germ line.

The functional GFP::DAF-16B fusion protein fluorescence was first detected in early embryos, prior to morphogenesis. After hatching and in all later developmental stages, transgenic larvae showed GFP in the pharynx and in many neurons throughout the body. From the late L3 stage onward, GFP was also detected in somatic gonads.

Paper.label: Lee RYN, Hench J & Ruvkun G, 2001

Description: Expression is observed from early embryogenesis to adult. Early embryonic expression is in peripheral cells. From late embryogenesis to adult, expression is seen in the pharynx, rectal glands, a subset of ventral nerve cord cells, a single neuron with a cell body in the tail and processes along the ventral side to the nerve ring. There is also expression in the vulva and somatic gonad, possibly the distal tip cells, and possibly the germ line.

The daf-16a promoter::gfp fusion construct (pPV199) was expressed in all life stages of C. elegans transformants. Bright fluorescence was seen in cells of the body wall, muscles, intestine and neurons but not in the pharynx or gonad.

Paper.label: Massey HC, Bhopale MK, Li X, Castelletto M & Lok JB, 2006

Description: Transgenic daf-16a::GFP animals show strong GFP fluorescence in most cells including ectoderm, muscles, intestine and neurons. The broad expression pattern of daf-16a::GFP is also seen in late embryos, larvae and dauer larvae. No expression was seen in the pharynx.

evidence.Description: Transcripts enriched in CEPsh glia cells comparing to RNA counts that were derived from all other cells.
evidence.Algorithm: DESeq2

Description: Expression is observed from early embryogenesis to adult. Early embryonic expression is in peripheral cells. From late embryogenesis to adult, expression is seen in the pharynx, rectal glands, a subset of ventral nerve cord cells, a single neuron with a cell body in the tail and processes along the ventral side to the nerve ring. There is also expression in the vulva and somatic gonad, possibly the distal tip cells, and possibly the germ line.

In the germline itself, DAF-16::GFP is barely detectable, indicating that daf-16 is expressed at low levels in this tissue. DAF-16::GFP, however, is expressed at high levels in the somatic gonadal sheath cells, localizing to the nuclei of these cells under normal fed conditions.

evidence.Description: Transcripts enriched in germline by comparing dissected germline tissue with dissected intestine tissue, both injected with empty RNAi vector.
evidence.Algorithm: Genes were determined germline-enriched if the lowest expression value (log2(FPKM+1)) observed in the germline empty vector samples was at least 2-fold higher than the highest expression value observed in the intestine empty vector samples.

Description: Expression is observed from early embryogenesis to adult. Early embryonic expression is in peripheral cells. From late embryogenesis to adult, expression is seen in the pharynx, rectal glands, a subset of ventral nerve cord cells, a single neuron with a cell body in the tail and processes along the ventral side to the nerve ring. There is also expression in the vulva and somatic gonad, possibly the distal tip cells, and possibly the germ line.

GFP expression was observed in many tissues from early embryo to mature adult. GFP fluorescence was particularly strong in many neurons in the nerve ring and tail, and in some neurons in the ventral nerve cord. One unidentified neuron in the tail showed particularly strong expression such that its axon, projecting towards the anterior, was also visibly fluorescing. GFP was mainly diffuse and spread throughout the cells in which it was expressed, but in some individuals the fluorescence  in some tissues, such as the seam cells, was much brighter in the nucleus.

Paper.label: Craig HL, Wirtz J, Bamps S, Dolphin CT & Hope IA, 2013
Feng H, Craig HL & Hope IA, 2012

evidence.Description: Transcripts that showed significantly lower expression in somatic gonad precursor cells (SGP) vs. head mesodermal cells (hmc).
evidence.Algorithm: DESeq2, fold change >= 2, FDR <= 0.01.

Description: daf-16d/f expression is dramatically increased at the level of transcription during the young adult stage in the intestine.

evidence.Description: Transcripts enriched in CEPsh glia cells comparing to RNA counts that were derived from all other cells.
evidence.Algorithm: DESeq2

Description: Expressed in lateral hypodermal cells from L2 to L4, vulval muscle in some adult animals, anterior neurons (not individually identified in this study) from L2 to L4, posterior neurons in some L2/L3 and adult animals, body wall muscle from L2 to adult.

The daf-16a promoter::gfp fusion construct (pPV199) was expressed in all life stages of C. elegans transformants. Bright fluorescence was seen in cells of the body wall, muscles, intestine and neurons but not in the pharynx or gonad.

GFP::DAF-16 protein localized to neurons, hypodermis, intestine, and body wall muscles.

evidence.Description: Genes enriched in body wall muscle AIN-2 miRISCs. Pmyo-3-ain-2-gfp IP was performed in mixed stage worms.

Citation.label: Kudlow BA, Zhang L & Han M, 2012

evidence.Algorithm: Enrichment values are expressed as mean percent rank. The p value was computed by comparing all enrichment values for a given transcript to all enrichment values of all transcripts by a one-tailed t test. Significantly enriched genes are those with p value < 0.01.

evidence.Description: Genes with expression enriched in PVD and OLL neurons. Data sets were normalized by RMA and transcripts showing relative PVD enrichment (>= 1.5X) vs. the reference sample were identified by SAM analysis (False Discovery Rate, FDR < 1%).
